intro: Pattalias angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pattalias, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
